This movie is a piece of the time in which it was made..... Realistic. Movies were not candy coated during the late 60s and early 70s. They were very "in touch" with what was going on because of how expressive and free they were. Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the country, the ideals he pursued and the books, paintings and haiku he made.
Genre: Animation ,  Biography ,  Drama
Actors: Akira Emoto , Juri Ueno , Teruyuki Kagawa

Okay. Here's the thing. I've read through the comments of other viewers --- some trashing the film and some saying it's the funniest, most enjoyable work of kubrick they've seen. This movie is good for some laughs and i think many are as surprised as i am over kubrick's level of comedy here.
Compared to Full Metal Jacket and A Clockwork Orange , it seems much less mature. But it's just as relevant and charming

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. "Les Valseuses" was remade as "Hardcore" (1979) by Paul Bartel but it was pretty bad when compared with this French masterpiece.

A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, left to die by the cruel family, rises from the grave, has sex with an innocent, female victim, and she and her boyfriend get pregnant.
